Dear Ms. Barnard:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation In January 2023, youth had a sexual encounter with a male staff
member. Several other staff members were aware. The
administrative team is also aware and have covered it up.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant was anonymous. Complainant texted a MDHHS
Worker to disclose the allegations and concerns. Contact was
attempted via phone and text, but Complainant did not return
contact.
3

Youth A was interviewed via phone on 3/23/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported no staff members were
ever inappropriate with her. Youth A stated no male staff members
every made her feel uncomfortable. Youth A stated no staff
members were ever verbally or physically sexually inappropriate
with her. She reported she doesn’t feel there were ever any
situations in which staff or administration covered anything up,
ignored complaints or left safety concerns unresolved.
Youth B was interviewed via TEAMS video conference on
3/30/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported
Youth A told her she texted Staff 18 once or twice, but never told
Youth B the content of the messages sent or received. Youth B
reported she never saw any text messages and never asked to
see them or asked about the content of the messages. Youth B
was not aware of any concerns or inappropriate relationships
between male staff and female youth. Youth B never had any
concerns about staff or administration covering up any situations
or leaving safety concerns unresolved.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 3/17/23, via video conference on 3/30/23 and via
phone on 6/8/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. CA
reported she has no knowledge of Staff 18 and Youth A texting
each other. CA reported there was a concern Youth A may have
gotten a hold of a staff contact list, so there was a general
conversation held with staff at a meeting reminding staff not to talk
to youth via phone or text. CA reported she was never told about
and has no knowledge of Staff 18 seeing or possessing a video of
Youth C performing sexual acts. CA reported if she had
knowledge of those incidents, they would have been reported to
law enforcement and centralized intake.
Administrator 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
3/17/23, via video conference on 3/30/23 and via phone on
6/8/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Administrator 1
reported she has no knowledge of Staff 18 and Youth A texting
each other. Administrator 1 reported she was never told about and
has no knowledge of Staff 18 seeing or possessing a video of
Youth C performing sexual acts. Administrator 1 reported if she
had knowledge of those incidents, they would have been reported
to law enforcement and centralized intake.
Administrator 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
3/17/23, via video conference on 3/30/23 and via phone on
4

6/8/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Administrator 2
reported she has no knowledge of Staff 18 and Youth A texting
each other. Administrator 2 reported she was never told about and
has no knowledge of Staff 18 seeing or possessing a video of
Youth C completing sexual acts. Administrator 2 reported Staff 17
never spoke to her about knowledge of a possible video involving
Youth C. Administrator 2 reported she had to speak to Staff 17
about not creating a negative working environment by gossiping
with staff and requested she come to administration directly with
her concerns, but it was not in relation to a specific situation like
text messages or a video. Administrator 2 reported Staff 18 and
Supervisor spoke with her about youth buying vapes at a nearby
gas station, and where the youth were when they went AWOL, but
none of those involved a conversation regarding a video of Youth
C. Administrator 2 reported Staff 18 continued to bring information
forward about where the youth were or what they were doing
when they were AWOL and she had a phone conversation with
him telling him he was a mandated reporter and instructed him to
contact law enforcement with the information so they could
investigate. Administrator 2 reported they had been notified Youth
A took a staff contact list from the staff office and was texting
and/or calling staff. Administrator 2 reported they had a meeting
with staff and told them they cannot text or talk to youth outside of
the facility because they are not friends. Administrator 2 reported
they told staff to block Youth A’s number and/or tell Youth A to
stop contacting them. Around the beginning of December 2022,
Administrator 2 was informed by CA that Staff 12 and Staff 18
were sitting in the staff office gossiping about what Youth C was
doing when she was AWOL, including having sex, and CA told
them to end the conversation because it was inappropriate to
discuss; especially since the youth were in the home at the time.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
3/17/23 and via phone on 4/3/23 and on 6/8/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor denied any staff, including Staff
17, told her about any concerns regarding Youth A and Staff 18
texting with each other. Supervisor reported she was never told
about Staff 18 having possession of or seeing a video of Youth C
performing sexual acts. Supervisor reported had she been
informed about either of these, she would have contacted
centralized intake and law enforcement immediately.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 3/21/23 and 3/30/23 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. On 3/21/23, Staff 1 reported a
Staff 19 mentioned the January 2023 investigation to him. He
reported other staff were talking about the previous investigation
5

too. Staff 1 reported CA and Administrator 1 talked to staff and
asked them not to discuss the investigation and did not disclose
information about the investigation. Staff 1 reported this
conversation concerned him because he felt they were not taking
the concern seriously and were “sweeping it under the rug”. Staff
1 reported he does not feel administration has done anything to
cover situations up, but he is not sure how they handle things,
which concerns him. He reported Staff 19 also told him she saw
the first name of Staff 18 on some text messages on Youth A’s
phone. He reported he never saw the text messages, so he does
not know what they said or if they even existed. Staff 1 reported
Staff 19 told him Staff 17 told administration about the text
messages. Staff 1 reported he does not know if anyone from
administration knew about text messages because he was not
present for any conversations about them. Staff 1 denied having
any knowledge of a possible video involving Youth C performing
sexual acts.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 3/21/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported he worked about 5-6 times
at the girls’ home. Staff 2 reported when he worked at the home,
he had to stop multiple conversations of a sexual nature between
Youth A and other youth in the home. Staff 2 reported he never
witnessed or heard about Youth A having any inappropriate
interactions or conversations with any male staff members.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/22/23
and via phone on 3/29/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker.
Staff 3 reported he only works at the boys’ home. He reported
Youth A was dropped off at the boys’ home two different days he
was working. Staff 3 reported she would come around 3pm and
stay until after dinnertime to help the boys with homework and
getting ready for dinner. He reported Staff 1, Staff 7, and he were
present one day. Staff 3 reported Youth A never had any
inappropriate conversations or interactions with anyone there.
Staff 3 reported Staff 1 and Staff 7 expressed they did not want
Youth A there because they were afraid, she might make up
allegations, since she was a female youth around male youth and
staff. He reported he has no knowledge of anything inappropriate
occurring between Youth A and any male staff. Staff 3 reported he
has no knowledge of any text messages exchanged between
Youth A and male staff. Staff 3 reported he has no knowledge of a
video involving Youth C performing sexual acts. Staff 3 reported
he has no concerns with the way administration has handled any
concerns or complaints brought to their attention. Staff 3 reported
6

administration tries to shield staff from a lot of situations, so he
isn’t aware of any details or results regarding those situations.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/22/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported he worked
primarily at the girls’ home. He reported he’s talked and joked
around with Youth A to build rapport. Staff 4 reported Youth A has
never said or done anything inappropriate during any of their
conversations or interactions. Staff 4 reported he has no
knowledge or concerns about Youth A being involved in an
inappropriate relationship with any male staff. Staff 4 reported he
has not had any concerns with how administration has handled
any issues or complaints brought to their attention.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/22/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 reported Youth A
had become like a little sister to him because he has a lot of
sisters and they come from similar backgrounds. He reported he
has tried to provide a lot of encouragement and support to Youth
A to motivate her to do better and improve her life. Staff 5 reported
he has no knowledge or concerns about Youth A being involved in
an inappropriate relationship with any male staff. Staff 5 reported
Youth A has never said or done anything inappropriate during any
of their conversations or interactions. Staff 5 reported he was
present during one of Youth A’s junior staff shifts at the boys’
home and there were no issues or concerns with her interactions
with any male staff or youth there. Staff 5 reported he has not had
any concerns with administration covering up situations or with
how administration has handled any issues or complaints brought
to their attention.
Staff 6 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/22/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 6 reported she only
works at the girls’ home. She reported she has never witnessed
any inappropriate conversations or interactions between Youth A
and any male staff at the facility. Staff 6 reported she has not had
any concerns with administration covering up situations or with
how administration has handled any issues or complaints brought
to their attention.
Staff 8 was interviewed via phone on 3/27/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 8 reported she and Staff 9 were the
employees who found the journal entry Youth A wrote in January
about having sexual relations with someone with the same first
name as Staff 18 (SIR2023C0000173). Staff 8 felt administration
did not handle the situation regarding Staff 18 appropriately
7

because they knew about the concerns surrounding interactions
between him and the youth in the girls’ home but gave him
another chance by moving him to the boys’ home before finally
firing him. Staff 8 reported she was told by another female staff
member, but she could not recall who, that Staff 18 had a sexually
explicit video of Youth C on his phone, but she never saw the
video or spoke with administration about it. Staff 8 reported she
heard Staff 18 and Youth A were exchanging text messages, but
she never saw any of the text messages. Staff 8 cannot remember
the name of the staff member who told her this information or the
name of the staff member who reported it to administration. Staff 8
reported after Staff 18 was fired, Administrator 2 and Supervisor
said in a staff meeting Youth A texted Staff 18 and Staff 18 replied
something to the extent of Staff 18 liking Youth D more than Youth
A.
Staff 9 was interviewed via phone on 3/27/23 and 6/9/23 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 9 reported she never
had any concerns about Staff 18 and Youth A’s interactions. Staff
9 reported she heard about Youth A exchanging text messages
with a staff member and the staff member supposedly told Youth
A “I like [Youth D] better”. However, Staff 9 reported she did not
see any text messages, did not know which staff member may
have been involved and could not remember who told her the
information. Staff 9 reported the administration team, including
Administrator 1, Administrator 2, and CA, held a staff meeting
where they provided a general reminder to staff not to have
discussions with youth via text or phone. On 3/27/23, Staff 9
reported Staff 12 told her Staff 18 had a sexually explicit video of
Youth C, but Staff 9 never saw the video. Staff 9 reported she did
not bring up the video during the last investigation in January
because she thought it was already taken care of. On 6/9/23, Staff
9 reported Staff 12 told her and Staff 8 about the sexually explicit
video Staff 18 had of Youth C during shift change. Staff 9 stated
Staff 12 said she reported it to administration and was told it was
being taken care of. Staff 9 reported she and Staff 8 decided to
also report the information to administration, but stated she could
not remember which member of administration they told. She also
could not identify a physical description of the member of
administration she told. Staff 9 reported this happened after
Christmas, before she and Staff 8 found the letter investigated in
January 2023.
Staff 11 was interviewed via phone on 3/28/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 11 reported she has not witnessed
any concerns regarding inappropriate conversations or
8

interactions between Youth A and male staff members. Staff 11
reported Youth D told her Youth A may have been exchanging
text messages with a staff member, but she does not sure which
staff member, never saw the text messages, does not know the
content of the messages and isn’t sure if they existed. Staff 11 did
not complete an incident report or notify administration about the
concerns.
Staff 12 was interviewed via phone on 3/28/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker and via phone on 6/16/23 without
MDHHS Worker. Staff 12 reported she has not witnessed any
concerns regarding inappropriate conversations or interactions
between Youth A and male staff members. Staff 12 worked often
with Staff 18. Staff 12 reported she never left him alone with any
of the female youth and always made sure she was present for
any interactions between Staff 18 and female youth. Staff 12
reported she does not have any knowledge regarding Youth A
exchanging text messages with a male staff member. Staff 12
reported one night Staff 18 told her he saw a video of Youth C
performing sexual acts with males when Youth C was AWOL.
Staff 12 reported Staff 18 told her one of his friends sent him the
video. Staff 12 reported Staff 18 started to describe some of the
details of the video to her, which she thought was odd. She
reported this occurred prior to Christmas because it was prior to
Staff 18 being moved to the boys’ home. On 3/28/23, Staff 12
reported she told Staff 18 he had to tell CA about it, and then CA
came to the office to discuss it with him. Staff 12 reported she and
Staff 14 were in the office when CA arrived, but they left the office
shortly after and she is not sure what Staff 18 and CA discussed.
On 6/16/23, Staff 12 reported she was not sure which member of
administration Staff 18 told about the video. Staff 12 reported she
never knew the outcome of the situation and was very confused
why Staff 18 was still employed after the conversation about the
video occurred.
Staff 14 was interviewed via phone on 3/29/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 14 heard rumors Staff 18 and Youth A
had something going on beyond a staff/youth relationship, but she
never witnessed any concerns with their conversations or
interactions. She was unable to say who told her about the
rumors. Staff 14 does not have any knowledge of text messages
being exchanged between Staff 18 and Youth A. Staff 14 reported
Staff 12 told her about the sexually explicit video involving Youth
C. Staff 14 reported Staff 12 told her Staff 18 was at a house party
with friends and someone at the party had a video of Youth C
performing sexual acts with someone. Staff 14 was told by Staff
9

12 that Staff 18 saw the video on his friend’s phone and
supposedly told his friend to delete the video. Staff 14 reported
she was not involved in the conversation or situation regarding
Staff 12 and Staff 18 telling administration about the video. She
reported by the time she heard about the video Staff 12 told her
administration was already aware of the issue. Staff 14 does not
have any concerns about administration hiding things or not
addressing concerns/complaints brought to their attention.
Staff 7, Staff 10, Staff 13, Staff 15, and Staff 16 were
interviewed separately via phone on 3/29/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 7, Staff 10, Staff 13, Staff 15, and
Staff 16 reported they have not witnessed any concerns regarding
inappropriate conversations or interactions between Youth A and
male staff members. Staff 7, Staff 10, Staff 13, Staff 15, and Staff
16 reported they have no knowledge about any text messages
being exchanged between Youth A and male staff. Staff 7, Staff
10, Staff 13, Staff 15, and Staff 16 reported they have no
knowledge of a sexually explicit video involving Youth C. Staff 7,
Staff 10, Staff 13, Staff 15, and Staff 16 reported they do not have
any concerns about administration hiding things or not addressing
concerns/complaints brought to their attention.
Staff 17 was interviewed via phone on 3/30/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 17 reported Staff 19 told her Youth A
was texting with Staff 18. Staff 17 reported Staff 19 saw the text
messages because Youth A showed them to her. Staff 17
reported Staff 19 told her one of the text messages sent to Youth
A said the sender erased the messages because he didn’t want to
get in trouble. Staff 17 reported she told Supervisor about the text
messages Staff 19 told her about. Staff 17 said Supervisor called
CA and/or Administrator 2 while she was present and informed
them about the text messages. Staff 17 stated Administrator 2
called her and told her she should not have told Supervisor about
the text messages and should have gone directly to her instead.
Staff 17 reported this occurred after Christmas. Staff 17 stated she
did not make a complaint to centralized intake about the concerns
because their policy is to talk to administration before calling
something in, so she notified them because she didn’t know if the
allegations were true. Staff 17 reported she heard other female
youth talking about Youth C being nasty, videos of Youth C having
oral sex with adult males and Youth A taking Youth C places to
have sex with males. Staff 17 could not name which youth were
talking about this information. Staff 17 reported she never saw the
video, but she told Administrator 2, Supervisor and CA about a
video floating around and they told her they would take care of it.
10

Staff 17 reported she feels administration handles certain
situations the right way, but others they do not. Staff 17 felt there
were multiple complaints made about Staff 18, but he wasn’t fired
for a long time after the complaints were made. Staff 17 reported
Staff 18 would take female youth to the store on a Tuesday or
Wednesday when he worked, but they aren’t supposed to go to
the store until Friday. Staff 17 reported another male staff often
transported the female youth to school by himself, but a female
staff should have been present.
Staff 18 was interviewed via phone on 5/18/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker and Law Enforcement. Staff 18 reported
he mostly worked third shift and there was always a female staff
working with him. Staff 18 reported he was never alone with any of
the female youth. Staff 18 reported he never had any physical
contact or sexual contact with any youth at the facility. Staff 18
reported Youth A would tell him he was cute, and she wanted to
“fuck the shit out of him” so he made it a point never to be alone
with her. Staff 18 reported he did not take the female youth to the
store because his license was suspended so he could not drive.
Staff 18 reported one time Youth A texted him from a female staff
member’s phone to ask him to bring her food, but that was the
only text message he ever received from Youth A. Staff 18
reported he could not remember the female staff member’s name.
Staff 18 reported one time he was at a party and saw a guy at a
party watching a video on his phone, so he looked over his
shoulder. The video was of a female having sex with a male. Staff
18 reported he saw the girl’s face and realized it was Youth C, but
he could not see who the male was. Staff 18 reported he is not
sure who recorded the video, but it looked like a third-party
recorded it. Staff 18 reported he never had the video in his
possession. Staff 18 reported he told Staff 12 about the video
when he got to work and Staff 12 told him he needed to tell
administration about it. Staff 18 reported he told CA and
Supervisor about the video and CA said she would call and tell
Administrator 3. Staff 18 reported a few days later, CA told him to
call a detective to report the information, but never gave him the
detective’s contact information. Staff 18 stated no one asked him
to write an incident report about the situation and no one followed
up with him about the situation. Staff 18 reported the only member
of the administration team he has concerns about is CA. He
reported he and other staff never knew what happened after
reports or complaints were made so they weren’t sure if things
were handled appropriately.
11

DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Text message from Complainant states they were
employed at the facility in January at the boys and girls
home. Complainant states the facility has neglected to
report a sexual encounter between a male staff and Youth
A. Complainant states those who knew about the encounter
were told not to bring it up again. Complainant states the
administrative team was aware of the concerns and
covered it up. Complainant reports there are several staff
who are employed at the facility still and have evidence it
occurred. Complainant states they are not an angered
employee who has been fired. Complainant states they do
not accept the way things are handled at the facility and
they do a great job of covering their tracks. Complainant
states the home is not a safe place.
• Notes from MDHHS Worker dated 3/24/23 including details
of her interviews with Staff 19, Staff 20, and Staff 21.
o Staff 19 reported she has not witnessed any
concerns with Youth A’s conversations or
interactions with male staff. Staff 19 reported one
time she heard Youth A mention she was
exchanging text messages with a male staff, but she
did not see any text messages and did not know the
possible staff member involved or the nature of the
text messages. Staff 19 reported she told Staff 17
about the information. Staff 19 denied administration
has mishandled, hidden, or covered up any
concerns reported to them.
o Staff 20 reported she was doing Youth A’s hair one
time and Youth A told her there was an investigation
happening regarding alleged sexual relations
between Youth A and a male staff. Staff 20 reported
Staff 1, Staff 3, Staff 7, and Staff 14 told her about
text messages being exchanged between Youth A
and a male staff. Staff 20 was told administration
was made aware of the text messages and Staff 1
told her administration “Swept it under the rug”. Staff
20 reported the only concern she had with
administration was she felt administration didn’t
consider concerns staff members expressed about
Youth A working as a junior staff at the boys’ home.
o Staff 21 reported she heard about possible text
messages being exchanged between Staff 18 and
Youth A, but never saw any text messages and isn’t
aware of the nature of the conversations. Staff 21
12

reported Youth A became too comfortable with male
staff and was touchy-feely with them. Staff 21
reported Youth A frequently tried to get Staff 18’s
attention because she was jealous of his relationship
with Youth D. Staff 21 reported she thinks
administration addresses situations but doesn’t know
if they fully handle situations because she doesn’t
hear about the steps they take or the outcomes.
Staff 21 feels they take small steps, but not the big
steps because they’re trying to cover themselves.
She stated things became better after the January
2023 investigation (SIR2023C0000173), but
sometimes it’s just for show.
• Notes from facility regarding timeline of Youth A’s junior
staff assignment. On 1/25/23 and 1/26/23, the arrangement
was discussed with all staff during staff meetings. On
2/2/23, Youth A signed the junior staff contract, and it was
posted at the boys’ home for staff to review. On 2/18/23,
Youth A completed her first shift as a junior staff, and she
had a female 1:1 staff present with her. Staff 1 was working
during this shift. On 2/24/23, Youth A was scheduled to
complete another junior staff shift, but it was cancelled.
• Text messages between Supervisor and Staff 1 dated
2/24/23 regarding Staff 1’s concerns about Youth A working
as a junior staff at the boys’ home. Staff 1 alleges Youth A
sat at the boys’ home the whole time on her phone talking
about inappropriate things. Supervisor notified Staff 1
Youth A was no longer coming to the home on 2/24/23.
• Email from Administrator 1 dated 4/3/23 stating male staff
can transport female youth without a female staff present.
Administrator 1 notes the boundary policy was put into
place to protect the female youths’ privacy to sleep so male
staff were not on shift alone doing bed checks without
female staff present. Administrator 1 notes Staff 18 did not
have a driver’s license and was not allowed to drive their
vehicle, so he would not have been able to or approved to
take the female youth to the store. Administrator 1 noted
staff are permitted to walk with youth to the store but are
discouraged from buying the youth anything.
• Boundary Policy (rev. 2/2022) outlines boundaries between
youth and staff. It states if a male staff is placed on the
schedule at the girls’ home, a female staff will always be on
13

schedule. Male staff are never to be unsupervised on the
2nd floor (resident sleeping areas) during sleeping times at
the girls’ home. Employees are to immediately report any
concerns of inappropriate advances, physical contact or
contact outside of working hours by any means including
but not limited to telephone, text, email, letter, or social
media. Employees are not permitted to exhibit any
behaviors that could be misinterpreted as grooming
behaviors (i.e., favoring one youth over another). Dating
and sexual relationships between youth and employees are
strictly prohibited. Disciplinary action will be taken upon
those who display unethical, unprofessional, or

Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Administration took belongings from one youth to cause the youth
to fight with another youth.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Youth A was interviewed via phone on 3/23/23 in conjunction

Staff 8 was interviewed via phone on 3/27/23 in conjunction

belongings. Staff 8 did not know which member of administration
took the belongings. Staff 8 reported she told administration about
her concerns because the youth was threatening to physically
assault Youth A, but they did not do anything to help the situation.
Staff 8 did not identify who specifically she told about her

Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed via phone on 6/8/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. CA reported there was a
situation where she was attempting to disrupt the relationship
between Youth A and another youth at the facility because Youth
A was a bad influence on the other youth. CA reported the other

when the youth and Youth A continued to get along. CA reported

Supervisor was interviewed via phone on 6/8/23 in

DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Facility Program Statement (revised 3/5/21) states the

• CA does not have any disciplinary records in her employee

Analysis Based on interviews conducted, this rule violation is established

Conclusion Violation Established
